intro: Koeleria bergii var. patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and delicate, feathery plumes. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, spike-like inflorescences. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
